대사: @Hello sir^ What are you doing now?@
@Hmm? Are you also my student from ⓑ(Miskatonic College)ⓦ?
@No^ it's not.@
@It wasn't? Well^ never mind.@
(The old man put his head back down and looked at the river as if our conversation had never happened.)☆①
(I don't think he's hearing me at all.)☆①
(A gray-haired old man stares off into the river^ muttering to himself.)
(Sometimes he even smell or taste the water)
'I'm a little relieved to see this. It's Arkham as usual.'
(He doesn't seem at all interested in what I have to say.)
(The dark sewer appears to be connected to the river.)
'It's really dark in here.'☆①
(Dark sewers^ locked with padlocks.)☆①
@Hmm... let's take a closer look.@♠②
(The moment I turned my head away because it was too dark to see anything.)
'What is that...?'
(As I focus my gaze on it^ which is shimmering very slightly^ I slowly see its outline.)
'It's a person^ it's eyes that sparkle.'
'No^ but how can those ⓡ(●1ⓒeyeballs)ⓦ be so big...!'
(Those eyeballs^ embedded in the position of a human eye^ looked two to three times larger than a normal human's.)
(It was also as distinct as a fish and had no eyelids.)
(I feel cold^ as if I'm in the deep end^ even though I've been making eye contact for a moment.)♠③
@What the hell is that?@
(When I woke up and checked again^ there was nothing there.)
(It's too dark to see anything properly.)
@What the hell is that?@
(When I woke up and checked again^ there was nothing there.)
@Hello^ Professor Kane^ I heard there's been a problem with the water quality here lately.@
column4: Kane // 키워드 강의 수질 비릿 x

대사: (Only then did the old man look at me and open his mouth.)
@Hmm~? That's right. Look at this.@
(He handed me a small vial of reagent.)
@What is this...?@
@You'll know it when you smell it.@
(When I smell the bottle^ I smell a light fishy scent.)
(It doesn't smell like a typical river.)
@That's a very strange smell^ is the water contaminated? maybe factory wastewater.@
@No^ Surprisingly^ the opposite is true. The water is cleaner than ever before.@
'That doesn't smell like clean water at all.'
@The quality of the water in the Miskatonic River used to be undrinkable without purification.@
(With that^ he took a sip of that water from the reagent bottle.)
@But now I've gotten to the point where I don't mind ⓡ(●2ⓡdrinking)ⓦ it right away^ even though it comes from a sewer.@
@Yes^ I see...@
'I don't think I could ever do that. College professors aren't just anyone.'
@But where is that sewage coming from?@
@You ask the obvious^ but it's the ⓑ(●1ⓢsewage treatment office)ⓦ in this neighborhood.@
@Anyway^ so I went to the lab and looked into it...@
(Since then^ most of what the old professor says is unintelligible.)
@Hello^ Professor Kane^ I heard there's been a problem with the water quality here lately.@
column4: Kane // 키워드 강의 수질 비릿 o

'Maybe this sewer is the source of the ⓡ(●4ⓕfishy smell)ⓦ the city has been emitting lately.'
